name: Granet al Roof Garden dell'Hotel Savoy

reviews.text: I have delayed making this report as I have been in correspondence with the hotel since a most disappointing evening at the Savoy on the day my wife was 70. This was a dinner we had booked weeks in advance before we had travelled from England.
reviews.title: They spoilt my wife's 70th birthday!

reviews.text: The welcome from maitre d' Ambily assisted by waitress Agnesica was excellent and they worked so hard to try to put right all the wrongs of the evening.
reviews.title: Wonderful

reviews.text: The first problem is that the restaurant is on the 6th floor and the actual roof terrace is on the 7th, although this I didn't feel this was too clear from the website, and from the promotional brochures, including the one I have in front of me now. Now this wouldn't be too much of a problem, as normally one can take pre-dinner drinks and post-dinner digestifs up some steps to the 7th. However, despite knowing of our intentions and advance booking, the 7th floor terrace had been let out for a private party and the staff told me that no-one was allowed up there, indeed I saw some diners turned away when they tried to go up. I have to say I did boldly go up just to see what we had missed - perhaps at my age, no-one was bothered to throw out this wrinkly old man in his stripey blazer......
reviews.title: Wonderful place to have diner

reviews.text: So, on the sixth floor you are partly open-air and have limited views if you stand up to eat - all I could see were pigeons on the next roof.
reviews.title: Unforgettable wedding reception!

reviews.text: Next the Menu Degustazione/tasting menu that we had. Perhaps we should have been warned when the menu told us that egg-plant was in the first course and the fourth. What it didn't tell us was that egg-plant was also in the 2nd course. Surely you choose a Gourmet menu so you can taste as many different flavours and textures as possible?
reviews.title: Fantastic food, great service
